intro: Sisymbrium reuteri, commonly known as the yellow rocket, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and ornamental plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and produces yellow flowers in early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. Sisymbrium reuteri is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields.
